attributes.action: Create a sliding scale for stamp duty to replace the sharp increase at £250,000.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The tripling of stamp duty at £250K causes a blight on the selling price of property whose actual value is in the region of £250K to around £300K. The inherent value of a property depends on the market in different regions, so this blight falls on a quite arbitrary fashion on sellers.
For example, if duty were levied between £200K and £300K at [1% plus 0.002% x (price - £200K)], the duty would rise by £50/thousand at £201K and £90/thousand at £299K, to be 2% at £250K, while remaining at 1% at £200K and 3% at £300K.
The blight on £500K+ properties is much less, because the duty rate increases in size by only 33%, not 200% - as it does at £250K.
The formula I have suggested is based on sliding the scale between £200K and £300K. If maintaining the present tax income were necessary, these figures could be altered, while still producing a sliding scale over a significant price range to remove the blighting of properties at any price level.
